result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done.  Out of up to 25% of prison funds and wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one (1) year Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim Felicia D.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary  by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael L Jones in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Michael L Jones in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.    The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:


*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim: Felicia D.
*Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Michael L Jones in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Michael L Jones in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.   

 On motion of the State, Court ordered the "repeater" enhancer dismissed.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   The defendant was REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Michael L Jones in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Michael L Jones in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defense counsel requests new date.  No objection by the state.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ORDER TO PRODUCE

Defendant Michael L Jones in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Michael L Jones in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel received some new information and requests new date.    Case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion in Limine filed.
filed.

Court is in trial.   Defense counsel requests new date.   Case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from attorney regarding discovery demand mailed to the state, received and filed.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court with defendant Michael Jones. Defendant appeared in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a final pre-trial conference. Newly appointed counsel needs time to review case. Jury trial date of 9/30/15 vacated. Case adjourned in branch 26. Scheduling order signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

against Judge Conen filed by Atty Anne Devitt on behalf of the defendant; filed.  Judge Pocan's Court is now the assigned court.

Parties request a trial date.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 09-16-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 09-23-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Parties request another scheduling conference date.

Defendant Michael L Jones in court with attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons for Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Michael L Jones in custody.  Ron Dague for Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sara Polka-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Felicia D or her residence

Defendant Michael L Jones in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Michael L Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
